other_tests.findings: Generalized, length-dependent polyneuropathy with prominent involvement of sensory axons but no electrophysiological evidence of a demyelinating polyneuropathy.
Enhancement and enlargement of the mammillary bodies indicating necrosis, confirming the diagnosis of Wernicke’s encephalopathy.
Low levels of whole-blood thiamine (45 nmol per liter; normal range, 80 to 150).
Low levels of serum folate (4.6 ng per milliliter; normal range, 5.3 to 9.9).
Low levels of copper (46 μg per deciliter; normal range, 80 to 155).
Low levels of zinc (57 μg per deciliter; normal range, 66 to 120).
Low levels of vitamin D (6 ng per milliliter; normal range, 25 to 80).
Administration of 500 mg of thiamine intravenously on an emergency basis.
